Package DSA.CustomDataStructures

Class MaxHeap<T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • DSA.CustomDataStructures.MaxHeap<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of elements in the heap, which must be comparable
    public class MaxHeap<T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>>
extends java.lang.Object
    The MaxHeap class implements a max-heap data structure. A max-heap is a complete binary tree where each node is greater than or equal to its children. This class provides methods for inserting elements, removing the maximum element, heap sorting, and peeking at the maximum element.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      MaxHeap()
      Constructs an empty max-heap.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      java.util.List<T> heapSort()
      Performs heap sort on the elements in the max-heap and returns them in descending order.
      void insert​(T value)
      Inserts a new value into the max-heap.
      T peek()
      Returns the maximum element in the max-heap without removing it.
      T remove()
      Removes and returns the maximum element from the max-heap.
      void swap​(int first, int second)
      Swaps two elements in the heap at the specified indices.

        public T remove()
         throws java.lang.Exception
        Removes and returns the maximum element from the max-heap.
        Returns:
        the maximum element
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the heap is empty

      • heapSort

        public java.util.List<T> heapSort()
                           throws java.lang.Exception
        Performs heap sort on the elements in the max-heap and returns them in descending order.
        Returns:
        a list containing the elements sorted in descending order
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if an error occurs during removal from the heap

        Returns the maximum element in the max-heap without removing it.
